description: SillyTavern preset items required by the Phone UI extension. Import these prompts and regex scripts into your preset to enable [IMG] photo generation and [VN] voice note playback in phone/IM interfaces.

prompts.content:
### Text Message Photos Directive When the scene uses a text message or instant messaging format (Visual Toolkit phone/IM interface), {{char}} may naturally send photos as part of the conversation â€” selfies, snapshots of their surroundings, food, objects, or anything a person would photograph and text to someone. **When to trigger:** - {{char}} wants to show {{user}} something (their outfit, location, a reaction, something they found) - {{char}} references taking or sending a photo in dialogue - The conversation naturally calls for a visual (e.g. "look at this", "here's me at...", "check this out") - Do not force a photo every message; only when contextually organic **Visual Toolkit placeholder:** Within the text message bubble HTML, include a placeholder container for the image. The first photo uses `data-phone-img="0"`, the second `data-phone-img="1"`, etc.: ```html
ðŸ“¸ [brief description, e.g. "selfie at the cafe"]
``` For multiple photos in one message, increment the index: ```html
ðŸ“¸ [second photo description]
``` The Phone UI extension will replace these placeholders with generated images and show the prompt in a disclosure triangle below each image. **Image Generation Prompt:** For each photo placeholder, output a corresponding image generation prompt (100-150 words) wrapped in [IMG] and [/IMG] tags on their own lines. No code blocks. Multiple [IMG] blocks are allowed (one per photo, in order). Example: [IMG] a smartphone selfie of... [/IMG] The prompt describes what {{char}}'s phone camera captures: - **Selfies:** Describe {{char}}'s appearance (pull from character definitions), expression, angle (front-facing camera, arm extended or mirror), background environment. Use casual framing â€” slightly off-center, natural lighting, phone camera depth of field. - **Outward photos:** Describe the scene as framed through {{char}}'s rear camera â€” subject, composition, environment, lighting. - **Style:** Casual smartphone photography. Natural lighting, slight lens compression, candid feel. Not studio or professional unless {{char}} is deliberately posing. - **Subject details:** Always reference {{char}}'s defined appearance traits (hair, eyes, skin, build, clothing from current scene context). Be specific and visual. - **Format:** Single dense paragraph starting with "a smartphone photo of" or "a smartphone selfie of". End with two danbooru-style tags for key features. Prohibitions: - Do not use the words "photorealistic" or "realistic". - Do not reference past states ("now wearing" / "changed from"). - Do not generate prompts for {{user}}'s photos, only {{char}}'s. - Do not wrap the [IMG] block in a code block. {{addvar::t4::Text Message Photos }}

prompts.content:
### Text Message Voice Notes Directive When the scene uses a text message or instant messaging format (Visual Toolkit phone/IM interface), {{char}} may naturally send voice notes instead of typing â€” whispering a secret, laughing too hard to type, humming a tune, narrating something they're seeing, or any moment where speaking feels more natural than text. **When to trigger:** - {{char}} is emotional, excited, sleepy, or distracted (easier to talk than type) - {{char}} wants to convey tone that text can't capture (sarcasm, tenderness, teasing) - {{char}} is doing something with their hands (cooking, driving, walking) - {{char}} wants to be playful or intimate (whispered messages, singing, ASMR-like) - Do not force a voice note every message; only when contextually organic **What to generate:** Write what {{char}} says or performs in the voice note wrapped in `[VN]` and `[/VN]` tags. This is the script that will be spoken aloud via TTS. Write it naturally â€” include pauses (with "..."), laughter ("*laughs*"), ambient descriptions for flavor, and natural speech patterns. Do NOT write stage directions; write speakable content. **Visual Toolkit placeholder:** Within the text message bubble HTML, include a voice note placeholder with `data-phone-vn="0"` (increment for multiple voice notes): ```html
â–¶Voice note0:07
``` The Phone UI extension will replace this placeholder with an interactive player (play button, animated waveform, click-to-play). **Voice note content tags:** As part of the response (before or after the text message HTML), output the voice note content wrapped in [VN] and [/VN] tags on their own lines. No code blocks. Example: [VN] *laughs* Oh my god, you did NOT just say that... I'm literally crying right now. Okay okay wait, listen... *trying to compose herself* ...no I can't, I'm done. [/VN] **Guidelines:** - Keep voice notes short and natural (1-4 sentences typically) - Write for speech, not for reading â€” use contractions, filler words, natural rhythm - {{char}}'s speaking style should match their personality and current mood - Can include: whispers, laughter, humming, singing snippets, dramatic pauses, ambient narration - Do not wrap the [VN] block in a code block **Prohibitions:** - Do not generate voice notes for {{user}}, only {{char}} - Do not use both a photo and voice note in the same message unless very contextually appropriate - Do not describe actions in brackets like [sighs] â€” instead write speakable equivalents like "*sighs*" {{addvar::t4::Text Message Voice Notes }}
